prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center** Your task is to construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and the cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The prism is symmetrical along its central axis. **Step 1: Create a new coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin of the CAD environment. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and leave the translation vector at [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will ensure that your part is aligned with the global coordinate system. **Step 2: Draw the rectangular prism base (Face 1)** Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. You will be creating a shape with 2 loops: one for the outer rectangle, and one for the inner circle. **Loop 1 - Outer Rectangle:** 1. Draw an arc (Arc 1) from point [0.0, 0.0882] to point [0.0882, 0.0] with a center point at [0.0258, 0.0258]. 2. Draw a line (Line 1) from point [0.0882, 0.0] to point [0.6618, 0.0]. 3. Draw an arc (Arc 2) from point [0.6618, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0882] with a center point at [0.7242, 0.0258]. 4. Draw a line (Line 2) from point [0.75, 0.0882] to point [0.75, 0.6618]. 5. Draw an arc (Arc 3) from point [0.75, 0.6618] to point [0.6618, 0.75] with a center point at [0.7242, 0.7242]. 6. Draw a line (Line 3) from point [0.6618, 0.75] to point [0.0882, 0.75]. 7. Draw an arc (Arc 4) from point [0.0882, 0.75] to point [0.0, 0.6618] with a center point at [0.0258, 0.7242]. 8. Draw a line (Line 4) from point [0.0, 0.6618] to point [0.0, 0.0882]. *At this stage, you have completed the outer rectangle loop.* **Loop 2 - Inner Circle:** 1. Draw a center point at [0.375, 0.375]. 2. Draw a circle (Circle 1) with a radius of 0.2647. *Now, the inner circle is created, and the base of the rectangular prism is complete.* **Step 3: Apply the sketch scale to the 2D sketch** Set the sketch scaling parameter to 0.75 to adjust the overall size of the rectangular prism. **Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system** Convert the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the Euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0], and the translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] provided in the coordinate system. **Step 5: Extrude the 3D model** Extrude the 3D model to a depth of 0.0441 in the direction of the normal. **Step 6: Set the description** The height of this prism is 0.0441, while the length and width are 0.75 meters. The shape is consistent with the provided description. Now that you have completed Part 1, you can move on to any subsequent parts and follow the instructions presented in the same clear, concise manner.</description>
